alert.note: Alert for Cheatham; Davidson; Dickson; Hickman; Perry; Williamson (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 12 at 10:34AM CST by NWS Nashville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Davidson, southeastern Dickson, northwestern Williamson, southeastern Cheatham, northeastern Perry and Hickman Counties through 1115 AM CST... At 1034 AM CST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles north of Centerville, moving northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Dickson, Ashland City, Centerville, Brentwood, Forest Hills, Oak Hill, White Bluff, Belle Meade, Kingston Springs, Pegram, Burns, Bellevue, Fairview, Lobelville, Berry Hill, Bon Aqua, Bells Bend, Lyles, Natchez Trace At Highway 96 and Pinewood. This includes the following highways... Interstate 40 between mile markers 151 and 158, and between mile markers 161 and 207, and near mile marker 209. Interstate 65 between mile markers 77 and 82. Interstate 840 between mile markers 1 and 11. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Brief heavy rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to minor localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Cheatham; Davidson; Dickson; Hickman; Perry; Williamson
